fit in.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if someone fits in, they are accepted by the other people in a group
fit in.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I never really fitted in at school.
I wasn’t sure if she would fit in with my friends.
fit in.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to manage to do something or see someone, even though you have a lot of other things to do
fit in.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The doctor said he can fit me in at 4:30.
I wanted to fit in a swim before breakfast.
fit in.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if something fits in with other things, it is similar to them or goes well with them
fit in.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I don’t know quite how this new course will fit in.
A new building must fit in with its surroundings.
You can’t expect a baby to fit in with your existing routine.
